metadata.description:
This is my genesis Sound drop, and the web3 debut of Catch Me.

The collector with the most editions at the end of public sale will receive:
- two (2) limited-edition, die-cut yadzi stickers mailed to you
- two (2) tickets to my upcoming show at the Viper Room Lounge in LA
- access to locked channels with exclusive content on the 'Into Our Hands' discord server

ABOUT 'CATCH ME'
I wrote this song at the height of the pandemic. I’d just moved across the country to LA a few months earlier, and I felt caught between the anxieties of my internal and external worlds. As I searched for my sense of self in a new and unfamiliar place, I felt more lost than I ever had before. I was falling apart, wishing I could just go back to a simpler time in my life - relive it, appreciate how good it was to not feel fear every day.

Flash forward to now: my emotional wounds have turned to scars. And with that healing, this song has transformed in my eyes from a lament into an anthem - a celebration of my personal perseverance, and our collective perseverance having made it thru the worst of the pandemic.

If you’ve ever struggled with anxiety, self-doubt, and/or hopelessness, then this song is for you. I hope listening to it helps release a bit of your existential tension as you dance, head-bang, sing at the top of your lungs, or preferably all of the above.

Catch Me is track #2 on my debut EP ‘Into Our Hands’. Huge thanks to the amazing cohort of contributors to the Into Our Hands collaborative crowdfund campaign - you all helped make this drop possible!! Special shout out to contributor Madmann.eth, who’s hand photo is featured in the golden egg artwork.

Check out the music video for Catch Me (directed & edited by yours truly): https://youtu.be/uJ26hbAFaio


Written by yadzi
Produced by yadzi + Zach Parker
Mastered by Conor Dalton

Art by yadzi
Golden Egg Art by yadzi + Madmann.eth

lyrics.text:
La da da da
Da da da da
(x4)

Help me I’m searching for my head
Lost it a while back when I left
Look to the stars, hold out your arms
Catch me I’m falling, falling apart

When you tell me everything’s gonna be alright
Is that a lie? Is that a lie?
I been waiting for a spark in the dark
But the fire won’t start and the sun don’t rise
Yeah the sun don’t rise
Wish I could fly
Right back where it all began
Nineteen, we were fucking in the back of the van
Carefree, blowing trees I was making plans
Whole world like a gun in the palm of my hand, oh
But now we’re lying on the bed
After everything we said
Both trying so hard not to be the one to cry

I don’t wanna waste your time
It’s just the harder I try
The more I fuck up my life
Cuz all that I seem to find
Are all the demons inside
(I think they’re getting out)

Help me I’m searching for my head
Lost it a while back when I left
Look to the stars, hold out your arms
Catch me I’m falling, falling apart

Help me I’m searching for my soul
It’s just like me, but made of gold
Look to the stars, hold out your arms
Catch me I’m falling, falling apart

(interlude)
(Falling apart)

When I told you there was nothing on my mind
It was a lie, it was a lie
I been holding my tongue from the jump
Imma give it all up and let it fly
I’m on my last life baby

Cuz I try to put it into words
But you act like you only heard
The one thing that I said
That made you pissed and now I’m picking up
The pieces of myself that I can’t tell are mine or yours
But no it’s fine, we’ll just move on, there’s nothing wrong
So there’s no reason to cry

I don’t wanna waste your time
It’s just the harder I try
The more I fuck up my life
Cuz all that I seem to find
Are all the demons inside
(I think they’re getting out)

Help me I’m searching for my head
Lost it a while back when I left
Look to the stars, hold out your arms
Catch me I’m falling, falling apart

Help me I’m searching for my soul
It’s just like me, but made of gold
Look to the stars, hold out your arms
Catch me I’m falling, falling apart

Falling apart

metadata.name: Catch Me #1
metadata.title: Catch Me
